page.title: 07RICHMOND SWIMMING BATHS
page.content: The Swimming Baths at Richmond (indoor and outdoor) were opened in 1967. The pools are filled up using a large hose and it takes about a day and a half to fill.They change the water completely once a year and keep it clean by passing the water through filters made out of crushed sea-shells.The temperatures of the waters are: 64-65F in the outdoor pool,71-80F in the large indoor pool and 84-85F in the learner pool. The large pool is 25m long and 10m wide.The springboards are 1 metre and 3 metres from the surface of the water and the platform board is 5 metres. There are between 24 and 28 galas every year. About thirty schools use the pool each week.There are a number of special clubs including an asthms club. It gets very busy on hot days in summer when people enjoy swimming and sunbathing on the grass.
